title: Youtube != Shorts
text: Forcefully shoving shorts into everything from Feed to search results without giving any option to hide them is bad UX.

title: Annoying
text:
Terrible suggestions. I spend an hour everyday just rejecting all your suggestions before it’ll finally understand what I am and am not looking to see. It’ll think I’m looking to watch the same video twice or thrice even after saying “I’m not interested, I’ve already seen the video”. 

Another issue lately, the ad skip button/timer. “Skip in 3…. 2…. 1……… 2….. 1….”
It’ll count to zero but just reset back to a higher number so I’m forced to go to the next ad instead of skipping it.

title: Shell of its former self
text: YouTube used to be so enjoyable but now it’s a bit of a joke. You get ads every 5 minutes on live. Sometimes these ads can be anywhere from 30 seconds to 18 minutes. An 18 minute ad? What if I can’t skip because I’m driving? Also firing all of your YouTube music staff? Yeah I’m not buying anything from YouTube they can take their ads and shove it up their assets

title: Still Relevant After All These Years
text:
Who'd've thought, right? This platform ought to be a dinosaur by now; however, I was quite surprised to hear that amongst the under-30 crowd, YouTube is almost keeping pace with TikTok. So, not bad, and not under the ownership of Chinese citizens. Bonus.

Why not five stars then? Ads, ads, ads everywhere! I really don't blame YouTube for that as they're just keeping pace with the rest of our postmodern world. Oh but think again — why not blame YouTube? If they want to be out in front of the race, why not truly take the most progressive stance and show fewer ads? Am I right or am I RIGHT? Let's all be more-evolved capitalists. 🏋🏽💸😇
